segment.source: How Configuration Passes Work
segment.target: How Configuration Passes Work

segment.source: How Configuration Passes Work
segment.target: How Configuration Passes Work

segment.source: How Configuration Passes Work
segment.target: How Configuration Passes Work

segment.source: Configuration passes are the phases of a Windows® installation during which you can customize an image.
segment.target: Configuration passes are the phases of a Windows® installation during which you can customize an image.

segment.source: Windows unattended installation settings can be applied in one or more configuration passes, depending on the setting you use.
segment.target: Windows unattended installation settings can be applied in one or more configuration passes, depending on the setting you use.

segment.source: Understanding how and when configuration passes run is very important in developing a Windows deployment strategy.
segment.target: Understanding how and when configuration passes run is very important in developing a Windows deployment strategy.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Understanding Configuration Passes
segment.target: Understanding Configuration Passes

segment.source: Configuring Device Drivers
segment.target: Configuring Device Drivers

segment.source: Configuring International Settings
segment.target: Configuring International Settings

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: Understanding Configuration Passes
segment.target: Understanding Configuration Passes

segment.source: The following diagram shows the relationship between the configuration passes relative to the different deployment tools.
segment.target: The following diagram shows the relationship between the configuration passes relative to the different deployment tools.

segment.source: configuration passes overview
segment.target: configuration passes overview

segment.source: Not all configuration passes run in a particular installation of Windows.
segment.target: Not all configuration passes run in a particular installation of Windows.

segment.source: Some configuration passes, such as auditSystem and auditUser, run only if you boot the computer to audit mode.
segment.target: Some configuration passes, such as auditSystem and auditUser, run only if you boot the computer to audit mode.

segment.source: Most Windows Setup unattend settings can be added to either the specialize or the oobeSystem configuration pass.
segment.target: Most Windows Setup unattend settings can be added to either the specialize or the oobeSystem configuration pass.

segment.source: The other configuration passes can also be useful in certain situations.
segment.target: The other configuration passes can also be useful in certain situations.

segment.source: The following table describes each of the configuration passes.
segment.target: The following table describes each of the configuration passes.

segment.source: Configuration pass
segment.target: Configuration pass

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Configuration pass runs when
segment.target: Configuration pass runs when

segment.source: windowsPE
segment.target: windowsPE

segment.source: Many aspects of the installation process can be automated during the windowsPE configuration pass.
segment.target: Many aspects of the installation process can be automated during the windowsPE configuration pass.

segment.source: In this pass you can configure:
segment.target: In this pass you can configure:

segment.source: Windows PE options
segment.target: Windows PE options

segment.source: These options can include specifying the location of the Windows PE log file, which enables networking or a Windows PE page file.
segment.target: These options can include specifying the location of the Windows PE log file, which enables networking or a Windows PE page file.

segment.source: Windows Setup options
segment.target: Windows Setup options

segment.source: These options can include specifying the Windows image to install and configuring a disk on the destination computer.
segment.target: These options can include specifying the Windows image to install and configuring a disk on the destination computer.

segment.source: During this configuration pass, the Windows image is copied to the destination computer after the settings in the windowsPE configuration pass are processed.
segment.target: During this configuration pass, the Windows image is copied to the destination computer after the settings in the windowsPE configuration pass are processed.

segment.source: If your installation of Windows PE requires boot-critical drivers to access the local hard disk drive or a network, use this configuration pass to add drivers to the Windows PE driver store and to reflect the required boot-critical drivers
segment.target: If your installation of Windows PE requires boot-critical drivers to access the local hard disk drive or a network, use this configuration pass to add drivers to the Windows PE driver store and to reflect the required boot-critical drivers

segment.source: One of the following occurs:
segment.target: One of the following occurs:

segment.source: Booting the Windows Setup media
segment.target: Booting the Windows Setup media

segment.source: Starting Windows Setup from a previous Windows installation
segment.target: Starting Windows Setup from a previous Windows installation

segment.source: The Windows PE options are applied only when you are running Windows Setup from a Windows PE environment.
segment.target: The Windows PE options are applied only when you are running Windows Setup from a Windows PE environment.

segment.source: The Windows Setup options are applied when it runs from either Windows PE or a previous Windows installation.
segment.target: The Windows Setup options are applied when it runs from either Windows PE or a previous Windows installation.

segment.source: offlineServicing
segment.target: offlineServicing

segment.source: This configuration pass is used to apply updates, drivers, or language packs to a Windows image.
segment.target: This configuration pass is used to apply updates, drivers, or language packs to a Windows image.

segment.source: During Windows Setup, the Windows image is applied to a hard disk and any settings in the offlineServicing section of an answer file are then applied to that image before the computer reboots.
segment.target: During Windows Setup, the Windows image is applied to a hard disk and any settings in the offlineServicing section of an answer file are then applied to that image before the computer reboots.

segment.source: During this configuration pass, you can add drivers to a Windows image before the image starts.
segment.target: During this configuration pass, you can add drivers to a Windows image before the image starts.

segment.source: This enables you to install and process out-of-box device drivers during Windows Setup.
segment.target: This enables you to install and process out-of-box device drivers during Windows Setup.

segment.source: This configuration pass is also used to apply updates to a Windows image during servicing scenarios.
segment.target: This configuration pass is also used to apply updates to a Windows image during servicing scenarios.

segment.source: Automatically after the windowsPE configuration pass and before the computer reboots.
segment.target: Automatically after the windowsPE configuration pass and before the computer reboots.

segment.source: During servicing scenarios when you specify an answer file by using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool (Dism.exe).
segment.target: During servicing scenarios when you specify an answer file by using the Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool (Dism.exe).

segment.source: specialize
segment.target: specialize

segment.source: This configuration pass is used to create and configure information in the Windows image, and is specific to the hardware that the Windows image is installing to.
segment.target: This configuration pass is used to create and configure information in the Windows image, and is specific to the hardware that the Windows image is installing to.

segment.source: After the Windows image boots for the first time, the specialize configuration pass runs.
segment.target: After the Windows image boots for the first time, the specialize configuration pass runs.

segment.source: During this pass, unique security IDs (SIDs) are created.
segment.target: During this pass, unique security IDs (SIDs) are created.

segment.source: Additionally, you can configure many Windows features, including network settings, international settings, and domain information.
segment.target: Additionally, you can configure many Windows features, including network settings, international settings, and domain information.

segment.source: The answer file settings for the specialize pass appear in audit mode.
segment.target: The answer file settings for the specialize pass appear in audit mode.

segment.source: When a computer boots to audit mode, the auditSystem pass runs, and the computer processes the auditUser settings.
segment.target: When a computer boots to audit mode, the auditSystem pass runs, and the computer processes the auditUser settings.

segment.source: Automatically when the Windows image boots for the first time.
segment.target: Automatically when the Windows image boots for the first time.

segment.source: On the next boot after you run the sysprep command with the /generalize option.
segment.target: On the next boot after you run the sysprep command with the /generalize option.

segment.source: generalize
segment.target: generalize

segment.source: During this configuration pass, computer-specific information is removed from the Windows installation enabling you to capture and reapply the Windows image to different computers.
segment.target: During this configuration pass, computer-specific information is removed from the Windows installation enabling you to capture and reapply the Windows image to different computers.

segment.source: For example, during this pass, the unique security ID (SID), unique device drivers, and other hardware-specific settings are removed from the image.
segment.target: For example, during this pass, the unique security ID (SID), unique device drivers, and other hardware-specific settings are removed from the image.

segment.source: This configuration pass enables you to minimally configure the sysprep /generalize command, in addition to configuring other Windows settings that must persist on your master image.
segment.target: This configuration pass enables you to minimally configure the sysprep /generalize command, in addition to configuring other Windows settings that must persist on your master image.

segment.source: After the generalize pass finishes, the next time that Windows image boots, the specialize configuration pass runs.
segment.target: After the generalize pass finishes, the next time that Windows image boots, the specialize configuration pass runs.

segment.source: If you want to retain the unique device drivers that are installed to your Windows installation, you can use the Microsoft-Windows-PnpSysprep | setting.
segment.target: If you want to retain the unique device drivers that are installed to your Windows installation, you can use the Microsoft-Windows-PnpSysprep | setting.

segment.source: If this setting is configured, unique device drivers are not removed from the installation.
segment.target: If this setting is configured, unique device drivers are not removed from the installation.

segment.source: The following setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | .
segment.target: The following setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | .

segment.source: or -
segment.target: or -

segment.source: Run the sysprep /generalize command.
segment.target: Run the sysprep /generalize command.

segment.source: auditSystem
segment.target: auditSystem

segment.source: During this configuration pass, settings are processed when Windows is running in system context, before a user logs onto the computer in Aaudit mode.
segment.target: During this configuration pass, settings are processed when Windows is running in system context, before a user logs onto the computer in Aaudit mode.

segment.source: This pass is typically used to make additional configurations to an installation, such as installing out-of-box device drivers.
segment.target: This pass is typically used to make additional configurations to an installation, such as installing out-of-box device drivers.

segment.source: This pass runs only when a computer is configured to boot to audit mode.
segment.target: This pass runs only when a computer is configured to boot to audit mode.

segment.source: The following unattended Setup setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | Audit.
segment.target: The following unattended Setup setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | Audit.

segment.source: or -
segment.target: or -

segment.source: Run the sysprep command with the /audit option.
segment.target: Run the sysprep command with the /audit option.

segment.source: auditUser
segment.target: auditUser

segment.source: This pass processes unattended Setup settings, after a user logs onto the computer in audit mode.
segment.target: This pass processes unattended Setup settings, after a user logs onto the computer in audit mode.

segment.source: This pass is typically used to run custom commands or configure Windows Shell options.
segment.target: This pass is typically used to run custom commands or configure Windows Shell options.

segment.source: This pass runs only when a computer is configured to boot to audit mode.
segment.target: This pass runs only when a computer is configured to boot to audit mode.

segment.source: The following unattended Setup setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | Audit.
segment.target: The following unattended Setup setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | Audit.

segment.source: or -
segment.target: or -

segment.source: Run the sysprep command with the /audit option.
segment.target: Run the sysprep command with the /audit option.

segment.source: oobeSystem
segment.target: oobeSystem

segment.source: During this configuration pass, settings are applied to Windows before Windows Welcome starts.
segment.target: During this configuration pass, settings are applied to Windows before Windows Welcome starts.

segment.source: This pass is typically used to configure Windows Shell options, create user accounts, and specify language and locale settings.
segment.target: This pass is typically used to configure Windows Shell options, create user accounts, and specify language and locale settings.

segment.source: The answer file settings for the oobeSystem pass appear in Windows Welcome, also known as OOBE.
segment.target: The answer file settings for the oobeSystem pass appear in Windows Welcome, also known as OOBE.

segment.source: These settings do not appear in audit mode.
segment.target: These settings do not appear in audit mode.

segment.source: The following setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | OOBE
segment.target: The following setting is configured: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | OOBE

segment.source: or -
segment.target: or -

segment.source: Run the sysprep command with the /OOBE option.
segment.target: Run the sysprep command with the /OOBE option.

segment.source: For more information about Windows components and settings that can be added to an answer file, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference Guide.
segment.target: For more information about Windows components and settings that can be added to an answer file, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference Guide.

segment.source: For more information about logging, see Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files and Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs.
segment.target: For more information about logging, see Deployment Troubleshooting and Log Files and Windows Setup Log Files and Event Logs.

segment.source: Configuring Device Drivers
segment.target: Configuring Device Drivers

segment.source: To add out-of-box, boot-critical drivers during an unattended installation, you must make sure that the boot-critical driver is available on preinstallation media.
segment.target: To add out-of-box, boot-critical drivers during an unattended installation, you must make sure that the boot-critical driver is available on preinstallation media.

segment.source: Boot-critical drivers should be added during the windowsPE configuration pass.
segment.target: Boot-critical drivers should be added during the windowsPE configuration pass.

segment.source: All drivers are staged in the driver store, but only boot-critical drivers are reflected or installed in the offline Windows image in addition to the Windows PE image.
segment.target: All drivers are staged in the driver store, but only boot-critical drivers are reflected or installed in the offline Windows image in addition to the Windows PE image.

segment.source: Non-boot-critical drivers can be added to the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: Non-boot-critical drivers can be added to the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: This makes sure that boot-critical drivers are available and when the computer boots, the driver will load.
segment.target: This makes sure that boot-critical drivers are available and when the computer boots, the driver will load.

segment.source: For more information, see Device Drivers and Deployment Overview.
segment.target: For more information, see Device Drivers and Deployment Overview.

segment.source: Configuring International Settings
segment.target: Configuring International Settings

segment.source: International settings are available in multiple configuration passes, to enable you to customize the Windows image based on customer requirements and different deployment scenarios.
segment.target: International settings are available in multiple configuration passes, to enable you to customize the Windows image based on customer requirements and different deployment scenarios.

segment.source: For example, if you build a computer in the United States (which would be an en-US international setting), you might perform all your tests in English.
segment.target: For example, if you build a computer in the United States (which would be an en-US international setting), you might perform all your tests in English.

segment.source: However, if you intend to deliver the computer to France and need Windows to boot in French, you can add the fr-FR language pack, if the language pack is not already installed, and then configure the Microsoft-Windows-International-Core component to apply fr-FR settings during the specialize configuration pass.
segment.target: However, if you intend to deliver the computer to France and need Windows to boot in French, you can add the fr-FR language pack, if the language pack is not already installed, and then configure the Microsoft-Windows-International-Core component to apply fr-FR settings during the specialize configuration pass.

segment.source: When the computer boots, the installation will display English text.
segment.target: When the computer boots, the installation will display English text.

segment.source: However, after the specialize configuration pass finishes, French text will be displayed.
segment.target: However, after the specialize configuration pass finishes, French text will be displayed.

segment.source: You can use DISM to configure the language settings of a Windows image (either online or offline).
segment.target: You can use DISM to configure the language settings of a Windows image (either online or offline).

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Languages and International Servicing Command-Line Options.

segment.source: By default, Windows Welcome displays a Regional Settings user interface (UI) page for the end user to select default language, locale, and input settings.
segment.target: By default, Windows Welcome displays a Regional Settings user interface (UI) page for the end user to select default language, locale, and input settings.

segment.source: You can preconfigure the settings on this UI page by specifying language and locale settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass in the Microsoft-Windows-International-Core component.
segment.target: You can preconfigure the settings on this UI page by specifying language and locale settings in the oobeSystem configuration pass in the Microsoft-Windows-International-Core component.

segment.source: If settings are set in oobeSystem configuration pass, the Regional Settings page is skipped.
segment.target: If settings are set in oobeSystem configuration pass, the Regional Settings page is skipped.

segment.source: If language settings are configured during specialize, the Regional Settings page will be displayed.
segment.target: If language settings are configured during specialize, the Regional Settings page will be displayed.

segment.source: For more information, see Add Language Packs to Windows.
segment.target: For more information, see Add Language Packs to Windows.

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: The following sections describe sample deployment scenarios and describe when configuration passes run.
segment.target: The following sections describe sample deployment scenarios and describe when configuration passes run.

segment.source: To run Windows Setup
segment.target: To run Windows Setup

segment.source: In this scenario, you install Windows to a new computer.
segment.target: In this scenario, you install Windows to a new computer.

segment.source: You start with the Windows product media and an answer file.
segment.target: You start with the Windows product media and an answer file.

segment.source: Run Windows Setup and specify an answer file.
segment.target: Run Windows Setup and specify an answer file.

segment.source: Windows Setup starts.
segment.target: Windows Setup starts.

segment.source: The windowsPE configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The windowsPE configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Settings in the section of an answer file are processed.
segment.target: Settings in the section of an answer file are processed.

segment.source: There are two different types of settings that you can configure during the windowsPE configuration pass: Settings that apply to the Windows PE environment, such as the display resolution and log file locations for Windows PE.
segment.target: There are two different types of settings that you can configure during the windowsPE configuration pass: Settings that apply to the Windows PE environment, such as the display resolution and log file locations for Windows PE.

segment.source: You can also specify settings that apply to the Windows installation, such as configuring disk partitions or enabling dynamic updates.
segment.target: You can also specify settings that apply to the Windows installation, such as configuring disk partitions or enabling dynamic updates.

segment.source: The Windows PE-specific settings in an answer file are applied only when you are running Windows Setup from a Windows PE environment.
segment.target: The Windows PE-specific settings in an answer file are applied only when you are running Windows Setup from a Windows PE environment.

segment.source: The Windows Setup options in the windowsPE configuration pass are applied when it runs from either Windows PE or a previous Windows installation.
segment.target: The Windows Setup options in the windowsPE configuration pass are applied when it runs from either Windows PE or a previous Windows installation.

segment.source: After the Windows image is copied to the hard disk, the offlineServicing configuration pass runs.
segment.target: After the Windows image is copied to the hard disk, the offlineServicing configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Any settings in the and section of an answer file are applied to the Windows image.
segment.target: Any settings in the and section of an answer file are applied to the Windows image.

segment.source: Typically, the actions in this configuration pass install or remove packages, language packs, or device drivers.
segment.target: Typically, the actions in this configuration pass install or remove packages, language packs, or device drivers.

segment.source: The system restarts and Windows Setup runs the specialize configuration pass.
segment.target: The system restarts and Windows Setup runs the specialize configuration pass.

segment.source: At this point, settings in the section of the answer file are processed.
segment.target: At this point, settings in the section of the answer file are processed.

segment.source: After Windows Setup completes, the computer restarts.
segment.target: After Windows Setup completes, the computer restarts.

segment.source: Then, the oobeSystem configuration pass runs and settings in the section of an answer file are processed.
segment.target: Then, the oobeSystem configuration pass runs and settings in the section of an answer file are processed.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can create a separate content file called Oobe.xml that you can use to customize Windows Welcome, Getting Started, and ISP sign up.
segment.target: You can create a separate content file called Oobe.xml that you can use to customize Windows Welcome, Getting Started, and ISP sign up.

segment.source: Using Oobe.xml is useful for organizing these customizations, because it enables you to maintain a single file that lists all of the branding, license terms, and signup opportunities for multiple countries, regions and/or languages.
segment.target: Using Oobe.xml is useful for organizing these customizations, because it enables you to maintain a single file that lists all of the branding, license terms, and signup opportunities for multiple countries, regions and/or languages.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure Oobe.xml.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure Oobe.xml.

segment.source: Generally, Oobe.xml is used by OEMs and System Builders.
segment.target: Generally, Oobe.xml is used by OEMs and System Builders.

segment.source: However some aspects of Oobe.xml might also benefit corporate deployment scenarios.
segment.target: However some aspects of Oobe.xml might also benefit corporate deployment scenarios.

segment.source: Windows Welcome starts and you can begin using the computer.
segment.target: Windows Welcome starts and you can begin using the computer.

segment.source: To run the Sysprep /generalize /shutdown command
segment.target: To run the Sysprep /generalize /shutdown command

segment.source: In this scenario, you will create a reference Windows image to use throughout your environment.
segment.target: In this scenario, you will create a reference Windows image to use throughout your environment.

segment.source: You start with a customized Windows installation.
segment.target: You start with a customized Windows installation.

segment.source: Run the sysprep command with the /generalize /shutdown /oobe options, to create a master image, configure the computer to boot to Windows Welcome, and then shut down the computer.
segment.target: Run the sysprep command with the /generalize /shutdown /oobe options, to create a master image, configure the computer to boot to Windows Welcome, and then shut down the computer.

segment.source: The settings in the section of an answer file are applied.
segment.target: The settings in the section of an answer file are applied.

segment.source: If you did not specify an answer file with the Sysprep command, the answer file cached to the computer will be used.
segment.target: If you did not specify an answer file with the Sysprep command, the answer file cached to the computer will be used.

segment.source: For more information about how to use answer files, see Windows Setup Automation Overview.
segment.target: For more information about how to use answer files, see Windows Setup Automation Overview.

segment.source: If you specified an answer file with the sysprep command, that answer file is cached to the %WINDIR%Panther directory of the Windows installation and will be used on subsequent configuration passes.
segment.target: If you specified an answer file with the sysprep command, that answer file is cached to the %WINDIR%Panther directory of the Windows installation and will be used on subsequent configuration passes.

segment.source: The computer shuts down, enabling you to boot to Windows PE or another operating system and capture the image.
segment.target: The computer shuts down, enabling you to boot to Windows PE or another operating system and capture the image.

segment.source: The next time the Windows image boots, the specialize configuration pass will run and Windows will boot the computer to Windows Welcome.
segment.target: The next time the Windows image boots, the specialize configuration pass will run and Windows will boot the computer to Windows Welcome.

segment.source: Using a Script to Deploy a Windows Image
segment.target: Using a Script to Deploy a Windows Image

segment.source: In this scenario, you boot the computer with a master image on which the sysprep /generalize /shutdown /oobe command was run and the image was captured.
segment.target: In this scenario, you boot the computer with a master image on which the sysprep /generalize /shutdown /oobe command was run and the image was captured.

segment.source: You start with a master image, Windows PE and the DISM tool.
segment.target: You start with a master image, Windows PE and the DISM tool.

segment.source: Apply the master image to a computer by using the dism command with the /apply-image option.
segment.target: Apply the master image to a computer by using the dism command with the /apply-image option.

segment.source: Boot the computer with the master image.
segment.target: Boot the computer with the master image.

segment.source: Windows starts.
segment.target: Windows starts.

segment.source: The specialize configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The specialize configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.
segment.target: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.

segment.source: The computer restarts.
segment.target: The computer restarts.

segment.source: The oobeSystem configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The oobeSystem configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.
segment.target: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.

segment.source: Windows Welcome starts and you can begin using your computer.
segment.target: Windows Welcome starts and you can begin using your computer.

segment.source: To boot Windows to audit mode
segment.target: To boot Windows to audit mode

segment.source: In this scenario, you boot a Windows image that is configured to start in audit mode.
segment.target: In this scenario, you boot a Windows image that is configured to start in audit mode.

segment.source: Audit mode is useful for adding custom applications, drivers, and other updates to a master image.
segment.target: Audit mode is useful for adding custom applications, drivers, and other updates to a master image.

segment.source: You can configure a Windows image to boot the computer to audit mode by configuring the following setting in an answer file: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | Audit or, run the Sysprep command with the /audit option.
segment.target: You can configure a Windows image to boot the computer to audit mode by configuring the following setting in an answer file: Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | Audit or, run the Sysprep command with the /audit option.

segment.source: Configure the Windows image to boot the computer to audit mode.
segment.target: Configure the Windows image to boot the computer to audit mode.

segment.source: In this scenario, run the sysprep command with the /audit /reboot options.
segment.target: In this scenario, run the sysprep command with the /audit /reboot options.

segment.source: Windows reboots the computer.
segment.target: Windows reboots the computer.

segment.source: The auditSystem configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The auditSystem configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.
segment.target: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.

segment.source: The Built-in administrator account is enabled.
segment.target: The Built-in administrator account is enabled.

segment.source: The auditUser configuration pass runs.
segment.target: The auditUser configuration pass runs.

segment.source: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.
segment.target: Settings in the section of the answer file are processed.

segment.source: The desktop appears.
segment.target: The desktop appears.

segment.source: The next time that you reboot the computer, it will boot to audit mode again.
segment.target: The next time that you reboot the computer, it will boot to audit mode again.

segment.source: To configure the computer to boot to Windows Welcome, you must use the sysprep command with the /oobe option, or configure the Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | setting to oobe in an answer file.
segment.target: To configure the computer to boot to Windows Welcome, you must use the sysprep command with the /oobe option, or configure the Microsoft-Windows-Deployment | Reseal | setting to oobe in an answer file.

segment.source: To run DISM against an offline Windows image
segment.target: To run DISM against an offline Windows image

segment.source: In this scenario, you run DISM against an offline Windows image.
segment.target: In this scenario, you run DISM against an offline Windows image.

segment.source: Run DISM tool against an offline Windows image and specify an answer file.
segment.target: Run DISM tool against an offline Windows image and specify an answer file.

segment.source: For example, to list the package in an offline Windows image, use the following command:
segment.target: For example, to list the package in an offline Windows image, use the following command:

segment.source: Settings in the and sections of an answer file are applied to the Windows image.
segment.target: Settings in the and sections of an answer file are applied to the Windows image.

segment.source: The next time that you boot your computer, the packages and settings are processed.
segment.target: The next time that you boot your computer, the packages and settings are processed.

segment.source: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.
segment.target: For more information, see DISM Image Management Command-Line Options.

segment.source: To use DISM on a running Windows image
segment.target: To use DISM on a running Windows image

segment.source: In this scenario, you run the DISM tool against a running Windows installation.
segment.target: In this scenario, you run the DISM tool against a running Windows installation.

segment.source: Run DISM against an online Windows image and specify an answer file.
segment.target: Run DISM against an online Windows image and specify an answer file.

segment.source: For example, to list driver information in a Windows image, use the following command:
segment.target: For example, to list driver information in a Windows image, use the following command:

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: When you use DISM with an answer file against an online Windows installation, the answer file should contain only the elements in the offlineServicing configuration pass.
segment.target: When you use DISM with an answer file against an online Windows installation, the answer file should contain only the elements in the offlineServicing configuration pass.

segment.source: This is because some settings in the specialize configuration pass might be applied to the online Windows installation.
segment.target: This is because some settings in the specialize configuration pass might be applied to the online Windows installation.

segment.source: In some instances, you might be required to restart your computer.
segment.target: In some instances, you might be required to restart your computer.

segment.source: For example, if you add a language pack to your Windows installation, you must reboot the computer.
segment.target: For example, if you add a language pack to your Windows installation, you must reboot the computer.
